parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be officially sanctioned campaign material.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post uses the phrase "Ha Magyari Albert 96 évesen is elmegy szavazni, akkor vasárnap neked is a szavazófülkében a helyed!" which translates to "If Magyari Albert goes to vote at 96 years old, then Sunday is your place in the polling booth!". While it doesn't explicitly name a candidate, it strongly encourages voting, implicitly suggesting support for a particular candidate or party.  This is a subtle but potentially influential message.  The context of the post, linked to Kovacs Mihaly Levente's Facebook page, further strengthens this interpretation.  Article 36 (7) - a might apply depending on whether Magyari Albert is associated with a specific candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform.  It is designed to reach a wide audience, not just a select few. The reach estimate is ">1M", indicating a broad target audience. Therefore, it addresses the wide population.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post appears to be encouraging voter turnout. While not explicitly endorsing a specific candidate, the implicit message strongly suggests support for a particular political viewpoint or party. The use of a prominent figure, Magyari Albert, as an example further amplifies this effect.  The timing of the post, close to election day, further strengthens the argument that its objective is to influence the vote.  Article 36 (7) - c applies.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content. It's primarily an appeal to vote, not an informative piece.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not a personal opinion; it's a paid advertisement with a clear political objective. Even if presented as a personal anecdote, the context and the paid nature of the post make it electoral propaganda.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>518887677800234</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while not explicitly mentioning a specific candidate, strongly encourages voting and uses a persuasive technique to influence voter behavior. The context of the post, being a paid advertisement on Facebook by Kovacs Mihaly Levente, and its timing close to election day, strongly suggests an intention to influence the vote.  The implicit endorsement, combined with the broad reach of the Facebook ad, makes it highly likely to be considered electoral propaganda.  The lack of a CMF number weakens the case slightly, but the other factors outweigh this.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Magyari Albert</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Kovacs Mihály Levente, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu mesajul "Ha Magyari Albert 96 évesen is elmegy szavazni, akkor vasárnap neked is a szavazófülkében a helyed!", care, deși nu menționează explicit un candidat, are un efect electoral clar de încurajare a votului, implicit sugerând susținerea unui anumit candidat sau partid, având în vedere contextul și momentul publicării.  Efectul electoral este de a influența votul prin apel la emoție și la un exemplu pozitiv, fără a respecta prevederile legale privind propaganda electorală după încheierea perioadei de campanie. ID-ul postării pe Facebook este 518887677800234.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
